title: The Waikikis - Hawaii Tattoo (1961-1966  32 Tracks)
description:
The Waikikis - Hawaii Tattoo (1961-1966  32 Tracks)
CD (2000) To Mp3 128 mbit/s
Included: CD Covers and this Info

The Waikikis were a Belgian studio band, mostly known for their single "Hawaii Tattoo", released in the U.S. in 1964, on Kapp Records. "Hawaii Tattoo" was recorded in 1961 in Belgium and spent two months in the Belgian chart. It was a huge hit in Germany, spending 21 weeks in the Top Ten and also reached the Top Fifty in the U.S., Canada and the UK.

The album Hawaii Tattoo reached the number 93 spot in the Billboard Hot 200 in 1965.

Composers such as Jo van Wetter, Willy Albimoor, Hans Blum and Michael Thomas (the famous Martin BÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶ttcher) created songs like "Hawaii Tattoo", "Carnival of Venice", "Mein Hut der hat drei Ecken", "Aloha Parade", "Honolulu Parade" and "Waikiki Welcome". The Waikikis sold their colorful island reveries by the millions and some of their own creations like "Hilo Kiss" or "Hula-Hochzeit" ("Hawaii Honeymoon") even made their way into the charts in several countries.
